discourse_list.title: ETH Prize: Transcribed Developer Interviews [84 in total]

content.content: Recently as part of the ETHPrize project, 84 developers from around the community were interviewed. These were conducted over several months by Rob Bent, Sina Habibian, Andy Tudhope, Josh Stark + individuals from L4, ECF, Web3 and the Ethereum Foundation. You can find their original blog post here. The aim of the interviews looked to diagnose the biggest frustrations while trying to build dapps. The interview questions included:  What do you do? What are the tools/libraries/frameworks you use? What are your biggest frustrations? What tools don’t exist at the moment? How do you handle testing? What are the best educational resources? What was the hardest part about learning to develop with Ethereum? Are there any other questions we should be asking?  Interviewees  0x - Fabio Berger & Remco Bloemen 0x - Leo Logvinov 1Protocol - Axel Ericsson AmbiSafe - Oleksii Aragon - Jorge Izquierdo Augur - Jack Peterson & Sparkle Augur - Joey Krug Bounties.network - Mark Beylin ChainSafe - Aidan Hyman Chainsafe - Greg, Stu and David Consensys - Jon Maurelian Consensys - Nick Dodson CryptoKitties - Fabiano, Jordan, Nick DappHub - Andy Milenius Decentraland - Esteban Ordano Decentraland - Matias Bargas Dharma - Nadav Hollander EF & Mist - Alex van de Sande EF - Nick Johnson EthVigil - Swaroop Ethereum Foundation - Alex Beregszazzi & Pawel Bylica Ethereum Foundation - Christian Reitwiessner Ethereum Foundation - Fabian Vogelsteller Ethereum Foundation - Hudson Jameson Ethereum Foundation - Martin Swende Gitcoin - Kevin Owocki GivEth - Arthur & RJ GivEth - Griff Green GivEth - Jordi Baylina Gnosis - Stefan George Golem - Alex Leverington GridPlus - Alex Miller HelloGold - Dave Appleton Integral - James Prestwich Kleros - Clement Lesaege and Nico Wagner Kyokan - Dan Tsui Kyokan - Jacky & Matthew L4 - Andrey Petrov L4 - Liam Horne L4 - Richard Moore Leeroy - James Childs-Maidment LivePeer - Yondon Fu Loom - James Duffy Matthew Di Ferrante MetaMask - Aaron Kumavis MetaMask - Dan Finlay Modular.network - Christopher Brown Mycrypto - Harry Denley Mycrypto - Taylor Monahan Newline - Nate Murray OST - Benjamin Bollen & Paruyr Gevorgyan Parity - Fredrik Harrysson Parity - Nicolay Wolf Parityweb3 - Peter Czaban Phil Castonguay Plasma & Zepellin - Federico & Jaynti Pragma - John Palmer Pragma - Marcus Molchany Pyeth - Piper Merriam Quantstamp - Richard Ma & Don Ho Quickblocks - Jay Rush Remix - Yann Levreau Samsara Protocol - Gustavo Guimarães Scott Wright SlockIt - Simon Jentzsch SourceCred - Dandelion SpankChain - David Wolever Status - Ricardo Guillerme Schmidt Status - Richard Ramos Truebit - Sina Habibian Truffle - Nick D’andrea & Christopher Gewecke TurboGeth - Alexey Akhunov Ujo Music - Simon de la Rouviere Virtue Poker - Alvaro Virtue Poker - Javier Franco Vulcanize - Rick Dudley Week In Ethereum - Evan Van Ness William Entriken Wyvern - Christopher Goes XLNT - Matt Condon Y-Combinator - Ramon Recuero Zeppelin - Facu Spagnuolo Zeppelin - Manuel Araoz dYdX - Brendan Chou eWASM - Lane Rettig  You can find all the transcribed interviews here https://github.com/status-im/ETHPrize/tree/master/bounties_report/analysis More recently, I have been helping organise the raw qualitative information from the different interviews into an excel sheet. Categorising the different insights from questions & answers. Highly recommend that you dig through these if you have a 1-2 hours to spare. Here is the excel sheet that is somewhat organised and digestible https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1oj9VDHmhxPqQGKUAsISEnejdTnd-D5VAoRnVv2hDn6g/edit?usp=sharing // I am fairly slow with writing a summary for this but would love if someone else cold help / pick a section and summarise insights to share This is apparently a small step towards a something bigger. You can find out more about the project here: https://discuss.status.im/t/datasets-by-status/76
content.GPT-summary: The post discusses the ETHPrize project, which conducted interviews with 84 developers to diagnose the biggest frustrations while building dapps. The post provides links to the original blog post and the transcribed interviews. The author also mentions organizing the qualitative information into an excel sheet and invites others to help summarize the insights. The post also includes a link to learn more about the project.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: @pet3rpan, this is great work, as are other efforts to acquire and process feedback such as the EIP-0 survey and Giveth’s ScalingNOW! interviews. Understanding the needs and pain points of the various stakeholders is going to be critical to the success of the Ethereum platform. At the very least, this saves us from wasting time on initiatives and features that are not needed.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
